intro: Pentadenia ecuadorana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian pentadenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly serrated margin. Pentadenia ecuadorana is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests.
